body:
Here is a simple solution to your problem using dict()

l = [('a', 1), ('b', 2), ('a', 1), ('a', 2), ('c', 5), ('b', 3)]
ll = dict()
for key,value in l:
    if key in ll:
        ll[key].append(value)
    else:
        ll[key] = list()
        ll[key].append(value)

print ll  # {'a': [1, 1, 2], 'c': [5], 'b': [2, 3]}
title: Group list to dictionary in Python
